intro: Friedlandia villosula, commonly known as the hairy Friedlandia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Friedlandia villosula is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
